page.title: 01LATCHINGDON PART 1
page.content: Latchingdon is a fairly small village which is built along the main street although there has been some development in recent years.The Street is the main road to the rest of the Dengie Peninsula and lots of traffic uses it. We did a survey and found that 4376 cars and 616 lorries passed the the school between 8.30 a.m. and 3.30 p.m.That is 624 cars per hour and 87 lorries,on average. Although the school is in Latchingdon,many of our children live in Maylandsea, which has a lot of houses but few places to work. We asked our parents where they worked and found that 16 worked locally but many more travelled to different parts of Essex e.g.8 to Maldon,10 to Basildon,3 to Southend,4 to South Woodham Ferrers,4 to London and indivdual people to places like Chelmsford,Harlow,Grays and Wickford.
